title: My 12 Things I Can't Live Without.

comments.comment:
Pewds: Epic minimalist. 

Also pewds: Item 1 is a tape measure, so that I know the size of all the things I buy online
Even retired, this guy is better than 98% of YouTubers

I really appreciate the new content ever since Pewds and Marzia moved to Japan. Vlogs, talking to us, sharing the things he loves, and trying new food and stuff. I guess we all grew up and evolve along with Pewds.
I'm going around now in places and yelling "Anyone has a fish scaler?" hoping pweds will come up to me "Here you go bro"
For some reason, every time I watch Felix I feel motivated to fix my life.
Pewds described Minimalism perfectly - changing your relationship with items by treasuring the things that give you joy and function while letting go of the things that don't.

It's a bit surreal when I watch a more personal video like this from Pewds. I grew up with him, around 9 years old when I began watching, now I'll be turning 20 in less than 2 weeks. 

Pewds character development has been beautiful and as I develop into the man I want to become, it can be confusing, especially since my biological father left when I was around the age of 11. I really value seeing such a down-to-earth human give us glances of how he thinks. I strongly believe Felix is a good man. He's the kind of man I want to be. He embodies so many wonderful traits and virtues of true manhood in my eyes, none of the B.S. that self-proclaimed manhood gurus push onto today's vulnerable male youth.

Love ya Pewds. I can't wait to continue watching your content throughout my personal journey in life.

Haven't watched any of Felix's videos in a few years... Happened to stumble on to this one and immediately remembered why I spent my entire childhood watching his content. The warm feeling you get from these videos feels like actually catching up with an old friend. I am glad to see how much your content has matured over the years and I can tell you still enjoy making these videos. Looking forward to becoming an active viewer once again!
Sincerely: A bro since Happy Wheels Ep1
Half of these things makes pewds sound like a dad
Unlike almost all youtubers, your lifestyle and values are incredibly admirable.

1:05 - BMI MET2 Tape Measure
2:49 - Shoes
4:55 - PewDiePie Rhinoshield Phone Case
6:00 - Interchangeable Dumbbells
 - Swisschamp Multitool
 - Tsuki All Black T-Shirt
 - Grand Seiko 62GS Wristwatch
 - Gary Baseman Original Figurine
 - Books
 - Balisong Trainer Butterfly Knife
 - Wedding Ring
- PC Setup

I actually really appreciate pewds talking about little quirks and values he has with day to day objects and activities. I relate to a lot of them, like the balisong flipping and multiples of the same clothing. I also get the shoe thing, even though I don't do it myself, it makes perfect sense to me. This is why pewds is my favorite famous person, he's just the realest and that makes him the coolest.
The same socks is definitely the move. If all your socks are the same, you don’t have to bother pairing sock after laundry. You can just throw them all in a drawer
My heart melted when he finished with the wedding ring !
That Grand Seiko is class. It doesn't hurt to have a 3 watch collection. I loved that GMT you used to have. I'm glad you finally addressed the watches.

Powerful life lesson from pewds . If you can easily get things, it becomes worthless. I’ve understood that concept when I play video games and I use god mode and console commands. It removes the fun. Why do anything when it’s already done.
He's becoming a little more like a dad every day. The first thing he can't do without is a tape measure :D Real father. I wish them anything they need <3
I remember watching Pewds when I was an unborn fetus, brofisting in my mothers womb. Can’t believe how much we’ve both grown 9 years later. So nostalgic.

A very basic and repeated comment but I seriously love how genuine you are in your videos, and how you acknowledge your money situation, for example the shoes , you said it doesn't excite you any more to just buy anything you want. And that people may try to invalidate your feelings because "you're just wealthy" or whatever, but your own feelings are always valid and we appreciate you sharing them! ️

Damn I was 8 when I first watched him. Now I'm 19 in 3 more weeks. A journey in my life with Felix, see how he has changed over the years, and I will always support what he do. Was a youngster, blink of an eye, I'm an Architecture freshmen. Glad I found you Felix and Marzia.

p/s: wow, didn't think I would get this much like ever for a comment. Thank you y'all. Have a great new year.

The part where he talks about being able to buy whatever it wants, really genuinely makes me happy, I grew up watching Pewds, back when he had 100,000 subscribers, and couldn’t afford tickets to see Marzia, it’s amazing to see how far he’s come and he is still so humble, I love this man
When he talked about his wedding ring i almost cried. I'm glad to see how he looks happy and comfortable with his life now.
The fact that out of all the things Pewds currently owns and the things he can potentially buy, he cherishes his wedding ring the most is absolutely wonderful.
He looks so contented with his life. Makes me wanna put my life together.
It's hard to describe into words how amazing it is to see your character development throughout time. I have been really loving your recent content. You are awesome, keep being awesome

i used to think that having your life together meant being financially stable, but felix has shown me that theres actually so much more to it. its so weird because when i was a kid i was watching his videos for the entertainment, and now im 18 and learning a lot of important shit about life that i really need right now through his vids.
That watch is fire! Good choice bro!

As someone that's also into Balisong flipping, I would say that the complexity and difficulty doesn't come down to skill. Rather, I like to see each trick as a puzzle to figure out. How do I move my fingers in certain directions, and at what time? Once I figure out that puzzle, then I can perform it better because I now have the answer. And stringing those tricks into combos with other tricks I solved how to do... It's so satisfying.

I love how open minded he is, he doesn't gatekeep information but instead he willing gives it out without a sponsorship pay. Felix has always been so humble,  thank you for being you and learning what you have. I couldn't be any happier to look up to someone like Felix, my personal life models have failed me, but YouTube hasn't yet.
Love this type of content from you Pewds, would be cool to see more!
This is one of my favourite videos of Pewdiepie's of all time to be honest,  the way he spoke about the items he holds so dear just resonated with me.
I know you feel weird about sharing this stuff, but the fact that you share it anyway makes your videos feel so genuine, so I'm happy that you do :)
12 things that sparks joy in Felix.

Timestamps,
For reference:


 Tape measure
 Shoes
 RHINOSHIELD phone case
 Interchangeable dumbbells
 Swiss army knife
 All black t-shirts
 Watch
 Figurines
 Books
 Balisong knife
 Wedding ring
 Gamer setup

Pewdiepie = Epic minimalist

I think it doesn't matter much what you talk about compared to how heartfelt it seems.
ANNOYANCE! or that you love something or someone (or someone that IS something, if you know what I mean;) or if you're sad and blame it on Edgar. Doesn't matter. You feel with your heart and you heart beatbox your voice. Good video.

im gonna be completely honest, but i absolutely and genuinely love this new kind of content pewds is making after moving into japan with marzia and i truly hope this kind of stuff keeps on for a couple of years, i truly enjoy watching these.

Decision fatigue is very real, I do recommend trying to work out as many decisions that clutter your life as possible. I'm actively working on this since as a Programmer there's quadrillion different options for me and narrowing them down gets very tiring. So removing any extra decisions I'd normally have to make improves my life exponentially.

Glad to see Pewds also appreciates quality watches. They sometimes do feel like glorified jewelry because of the existence of smartphones and smartwatches but the craftsmanship and being able to tell the time and date when you don't want to look at another screen makes it feel worth it to still carry one.

Quality content like always. It’s interesting how the videos where I’m like “ so he’s just going to name 12 things?, that’s it?” end up being videos that I love the most & help me refocus on things I need to do in my life
man the intro still hits me hard even after all those years

it’s honestly amazing listening to how humble Felix is, and how the way he thinks despite having so much more than others is based around the more important values in life. glad to have been a fan of his for years, love supporting people like this!!
It took Pewdiepie his whole career to find himself. And now he seems so at peace with himself. He has truly become the best version of himself possible.
I 100% agree with what you said. Finding the things that you really like and actually treasuring them. That's it.

Pewds. I enjoyed the video. I def had a couple laughs and enjoyed knowing some of things I do are universal to others. You are pretty well versed in psychological  theory by the way. Selective attention theory is what you were looking for at around 2 minutes.

Felix I recommend elastic “no tie” shoelaces. It’s one of my ultimate “can’t live without” items. They turn any pair of shoes into slip-on’s while keeping your shoes comfortably snug and they have a very clean, sleek, minimalist look because you don’t have long laces hanging down.
Yes someone who understands the need for a tape measurer, even if most if the time I use it to see how big animals are
9:46 it's so real it hurts
15:59 i hear this is what Marie Kondo’s philosophy on keeping items. It’s not about throwing out as many things as possible, it’s about appreciating the things you love and keeping them in good shape

People in the comments should stop saying that he's retired if he can make this kind of content. 
I'm a huge fan of what he is making these days!
Merry Christmas, Pewds! Thank you for another year of epic content

Watches are definitely more convenient than a phone for checking time, I still have the habit of checking my wrist before my pocket for the time even when I'm not wearing one, since it's so fast and easy.

I love how you describe minimalism in a way that makes you appreciate the few non-minimalist things even more. That's such a cool sentiment. I also love the idea of being minimalist to make decisions easier. I have the hardest time making decisions.
The 1 pair shoe rule is actually brilliant. My reality is now changed, thanks pewdiepie guy.
Felix, I will need a  fish scaler tomorrow afternoon CET. These are my coordinates 43.7102° N, 7.2620° E, I will be waiting
It's so weird that I enjoy a Swedish man in his 30's talk about the stuff he enjoys for 20 minutes straight
The ending got me, I absolutely teared up
Keep making more videos like these... we love to see this personal side of you ♡

I honestly adore simple videos like this where he just talks about the little things he enjoy, vlogs of his and Marzia’s day, when he’d post book reviews, etc. They’re genuinely the reason I keep watching him after nearly a decade. It feels very personal and genuine

As someone who hasn’t watch pewds since good with cry minx and ken in 2012 when I was 12 and seeing this video at 23 years old I have never felt so much nostalgia and serotonin. He hasn’t changed but really has all at once
These are some of your best videos no exaggeration
Always feel happy seeing video from pewds
That's one of my favourite your videos now. Watching this video, I feel I'm talking to a close friend, who is sincere to me. And I see you're talking to each of us, so that makes me feel happier ️

I became somewhat similar to a minimalist since I moved to college bc I'm a very messy person so all my stuff takes up more space than it should, and I'm in a room smaller than the other rooms on top of there being 3 of us in the room instead of 2, so I have very little space in the first place, which forced me to downsize as much as possible. But even with that mentality I completely agree with pewds about watches, I can use my phone, but a watch is so nice and it doesn't loose its battery. Plus I'm so used to having a watch so it's kind of comforting to feel it on my wrist. My watch is a casio watch, they're great they make watches of almost the same quality as premium watches but they're so cheap. It cost me $10, I've had it for years and I've never noticed it get off by even a second, and it says it has a 10 year battery life, I haven't had it for 10 years yet but so far it's lasted for years without issues. It also is water resistant, in my experience essentially waterproof because I can shower, bathe, and swim with it, and it can handle depths up to some distance, I forgot how far but it's deeper than I can handle so essentially I can swim as deep as I want with it. And it also shows the day of the month as well as the time, so I can easily keep track of that, which is actually useful because it takes a few steps on my phone to see the date as opposed to my watch, just look at the number. I especially love that bc I have a terrible memory and never keep track of what day it is. I just wish that it had a bit more sophisticated of a way of telling the date so I didn't have to reset it every month that doesn't have 31 days, since the way it works is that it just has a cycle from 1 to 31, so on any months with fewer days I have to set it to the first manually, and I also wish it had the day of the week because I forget that too. But I got all the features I do have for a durable watch which will supposedly last 10 years, all for $10. That's just such a great deal I can't complain.

12:38 so, about the movement of the Grand Seiko..  
so what Felix was trying to say is that when a mechanical watch has a higher beat rate (higher than 21.600 vibration per hour) it tends to be a lot more accurate because the balance wheel moves much faster than the regular beat rate thus making it less influenced by external forces when you wear the watch
I think it's cool that someone measures things so much they need a tape measure on hand at all times for just that. I can't remember the last time I measured something
1:58 Felix enjoys measuring the little things... I get it... I do to...

I really enjoyed this video from you. It’s wonderful hearing you talk about these items and why they’re so important to you. I also like how you’ve adapted minimalism as such a casual part of your life where it’s useful and comfortable, not just doing to for the trend or excessively to the point where it serves as more of a hinderance than something good.

think this might be one of my new favorite videos from you!
I love this version of you. You seem happy and fulfilled.  Keep doing what you're doing and keep learning new stuff and trying new things.

It was good to hear you articulate why minimalism doesn’t have to mean being without some things you really enjoy. It’s the quality and meaning to the individual that determines what you keep. Never thought I’d watch one of your videos and then want to clear out sock and underwear drawer.

What Felix says at 3:18 is actually true, though it does sound privileged. It's why I personally don't necessarily link "success" with just money and am confused by rich people wanting EVEN MORE money. We're fetishizing the thought of acquiring something, not the thing itself; and once you've gotten it, the facade breaks, and you can see how fragile and useless most of it is.
Finally someone that understands the correct way to own shoes!! Thank you!
GRAND SEIKO! You have a great taste in watches!

Loving your work. I just want you to know, after everything is said and done, that what you've been and currently are to us is one of few the things I'm truly grateful for. As cheesy as it sounds.
also, ser fram emot nästa fredag
The philosopher of our generation

I think you’ve become a great influence and role model over the years.
It’s very sweet to see.
Pewd is like a big bro to us

I love how as i’ve aged from 15 yo-24 yo ive watched Felix and his different stages in life. This stage is the most genuine and its funny because the things he truly values is the husband/dad things like tape measures, a quality pair of shoes, and weights lol
Pewds, that Grand Seiko is class. The perfect every day watch, and the submariener - gs combo is one of the best “two watch” collection. Really good choices :D
FINALLY A ONE PAIR OF SHOES GUY. Everyone in my life has walking shoes, casual shoes, sports/athletic activities shoes, Gucci shoes for parties and stuff, INSANITY. 1 pair, 2 at best, supremacy

Pewds I hope your doing okay you’ve also managed to put a smile on my face when I’m going through a rough time I hope you can be happy as much as you made me ever since I was a kid bc you truly deserve it.

as a fellow gundam connoisseur can definetly agree. The amount of time choosing, build, fine detailing, cleaning and understanding fully an ms leaves an unrivaled satisfaction just glances of the finished product can provide. awesome vid
As a watch collector, I approve of the grand seiko, absolutely beautiful piece with the automatic movement

Watching this during a really rough day really made me feel, a bit better so thank you Pewds. Happy for you and Marzia again, best wishes. <3
Started working out in march .lost 30 pounds. Thanks man you’ve been there in dark times. Don’t stop.
I like these types of videos Felix. You could just make videos like this every so often if you wanted, and a ton of people would still watch them
ngl ive learned 1 thing or 2 or 3 in this video and its nice it feels comforting yk like it makes me treasure more of my stuff that I have and keep it nicely
He’s so real in this video, love seeing pewd in this light.
0:01 After so many years watersheep is still watching us

Felix: attempts epic distraction demo
Me, having ASD: Every group convo sounds like this to me

Most youtubers are under pressure to make the most current and "on trend" videos, flashy, colourful, loud etc just to make money.

(He used to be like that then thankfully woke up and realised it's not healthy)

Whereas Felix has realised he doesn't need any more money and he isn't obsessed with money like most people, he just wants to share his personal life and hobbies/feelings etc.

He does it because he WANTS TO, not because he HAS TO.

That's what makes him pretty much the best youtuber out there, he's genuine

This kinda reminds me of his first anime and book videos, he said he felt weird and cringe talking about it but its personally very comforting to listen to. Weirdly its helped me be more comfortable in my thoughts & interests. Really love these kinds of videos lol
Those mind control cases actually look pretty sweet & I could see myself picking those over others in a store
a beautiful piece of gran seiko, nice refined watch, very versatile and minimalistic, nice pick and taste pewdiepie
im so happy hearing about one pair of shoe rule bc I'm always out with the same pair and i felt odd because everyone had different footwear but this makes me feel better

anyone else looking at felix videos with a big proud smile on their faces? It's like seeing your big brother who has achieved everything he set out to do.
love you forever bro, so happy to see you happy

The tape measure is a must, I really thought I was weird for doing that (not really) but I just had the same attitude that you have about it, like it felt weird but it really is helpful especially in my case since I never really kept sizing in mind

Your videos and vlogs are just so therapeutic. I love your way of thinking. I know you have to tread around with somethings to not offend (some) people, but it’s so refreshing seeing how authentic and truthful you are about yourself and what you like, etc. You don’t have to own three things to be an epic minimalist haha. I think if they’re things you treasure and are meaningful to you, then you should always keep it. Even the small things. Great video, and Rest In Peace Maya (aka best girl) You’re new lil chug is absolutely adorable though. Would love to see them in more vlogs!! Have a great day :)
